sentences.english: The manly Roman woman manager by the chfirmionship had manwismanner.
sentences.chinese: 军旗旁那位有良人风致的古罗马女经理具有良人风范。

sentences.english: The manly Roman woman manager by the chfirmionship had manwismanner.
sentences.chinese: 军旗旁那位有良人风致的古罗马女经理具有良人风范。

sentences.english: I am my beloved's, and his desire is toward me.
sentences.chinese: 我属我的良人，他也恋慕我。

sentences.english: The manly Roman woman manager by the flag had manasmanner.
sentences.chinese: 军旗旁那位有良人风致的古罗马女经理具有良人风度。

sentences.english: The manly Roman woman manager by the flag had manasmanner.
sentences.chinese: 军旗旁那位有良人风致的古罗马女经理具有良人风度。

sentences.english: A dose of poison made the noisy manas nose rosy.
sentences.chinese: 一剂毒药使得吵闹的良人的鼻子变成玫瑰色。

sentences.english: As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, so is my loved one among the sons.
sentences.chinese: 我的良人在男子中，如同苹果树在树林中。

sentences.english: My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.
sentences.chinese: 我的良人白而且红，超乎万人之上。

sentences.english: Good man hate to sin because of love for virtue.
sentences.chinese: 良人因为热爱德行而痛恨犯罪。

sentences.english: He day Hulu, beloved strike expedition.
sentences.chinese: 何日平胡虏，良人罢远征。

sentences.english: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.
sentences.chinese: 我以我的良人为一棵凤仙花，在隐基底的葡萄园中。

sentences.english: A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
sentences.chinese: 我以我的良人为一袋没药，常在我怀中。

sentences.english: For Colltine's der love be kept unspotted.
sentences.chinese: 保持清白，为厚爱的良人。

sentences.english: My loved one is white and red, the chief among ten thousand.
sentences.chinese: 我的良人，白而且红，超乎万人之上。

definition: sweetheart/one's true love/the person of one's thoughts
good karma/opportune connection with marriage partner
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
my husband and master (archaic)/playboy of rich family/pimp
to stay together/to rely on one another
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
